sen.e: As the name suggests, Rokuo-ji Temple's Kinkaku (Gold Pavilion) is covered in gold leaf but there are no traces that Ginkaku (Silver Pavilion) was ever covered in silver leaf (on 15th January 2007 it was announced that a scientific investigation detected absolutely no traces of silver foil).

sen.j: 慈照寺の庭園には多くの名石、名木が配され、建材にも贅を尽くしていること、当時の東山文化が茶道趣味と禅宗文化を基調にしたものであったことを考えると、当初から銀箔を貼る計画はなかった可能性が高い。
sen.e: Considering that the gardens of Jisho-ji Temple contain many famous stones and trees with absolutely no expense spared in their design, and also that the Higashiyama culture of the period was based on the simplicity of the tea ceremony and Zen, it is highly likely that never were any plans to cover the structure in silver leaf.

sen.j: 「当初は名前のとおり銀を貼る予定だったが、幕府の財政事情のためにできなかった」という説や、「銀箔を貼る予定であったが、その前に義政が他界してしまった」という説もあるが、俗説に過ぎない。
sen.e: It has been said that there were originally plans to use silver leaf as the names suggests and that these were prevented by the financial circumstances of the Shogunate or the death of Yoshimasa, but these are little more than rumors.
